title: Kimchi stew

ingredients.content: 20 g dried shiitake mushrooms, cut into slices
1 brown onion (approx. 180 g), cut into quarters
1 fresh long red chilli, trimmed, deseeded if preferred and cut into thirds
2 ½ cm piece fresh ginger, peeled and cut into slices
200 g daikon, peeled and cut into thin slices (5-10 mm)
200 g firm tofu, pressed and cut into squares (see Tips)

preparations.content: Place a bowl onto mixing bowl lid and carefully weigh boiling water and mushrooms into it. Set aside to soak.
Place oil, onion, chilli, garlic and ginger into mixing bowl and chop <b>3 sec/speed 5<b>, then sauté <b>5 min/120°C/speed 2<b>.
Add kimchi, daikon, tamari, syrup, reserved mushrooms and soaking liquid. Place Varoma into position and weigh tofu into it. Secure Varoma lid and steam <b>13 min/Varoma//speed 1<b>.
Divide between 4 serving bowls and garnish with spring onions/shallots, radishes and sesame seeds. Serve with cooked rice or quinoa (see Tips).

hintsAndTricks: To make your own kimchi, refer to the recipe on this recipe chip.
Be sure to check the label of your tamari, as not all brands are gluten free.

Tofu is often packaged in water and it is best to press it before cooking to achieve a better result. To press tofu, use a tofu press or line a plate with paper towels. Place tofu block on the paper towels and cover with another layer of paper towel. Place a plate or a cutting board on top of the paper towels, then place heavy weights (books or cans) on top. Set aside for several hours until liquid has been pressed out.
We recommend using organic tofu whenever possible.
To cook rice or quinoa, refer to the Boiled rice recipe in The Basic Cookbook. If cooking quinoa, be sure to rinse it before cooking to remove any bitterness.
